metadata.Title: SoilTemperatureSWAT model
metadata.Extended description: Strategy for the calculation of soil temperature with SWAT method. Reference: Neitsch,S.L., Arnold, J.G., Kiniry, J.R., Williams, J.R., King, K.W. Soil and Water Assessment Tool. Theoretical documentation. Version 2000. http://swatmodel.tamu.edu/media/1290/swat2000theory.pdf
metadata.Short description: Strategy for the calculation of soil temperature with SWAT method

init.name: Init
init.firstLine: public void Init(UNIMI.SoilT.Interfaces.Rates rates,UNIMI.SoilT.Interfaces.States states,UNIMI.SoilT.Interfaces.Auxiliary auxiliary,UNIMI.SoilT.Interfaces.States states1,UNIMI.SoilT.Interfaces.Exogenous exogenous,UNIMI.SoilT.Interfaces.StatesExternal statesexternal,CRA.AgroManagement.ActEvents actevents)

process.name: Estimate
process.description: Calculates soil temperature by layers using the SWAT method (updates states.SoilTemperatureByLayers based on LagCoefficient, surface temperature, annual average air temperature, bulk density, water content and layer geometry).
process.firstLine: public void Estimate(UNIMI.SoilT.Interfaces.Rates rates,UNIMI.SoilT.Interfaces.States states,UNIMI.SoilT.Interfaces.Auxiliary auxiliary,UNIMI.SoilT.Interfaces.States states1,UNIMI.SoilT.Interfaces.Exogenous exogenous,UNIMI.SoilT.Interfaces.StatesExternal statesexternal,CRA.AgroManagement.ActEvents actevents)

inputs.name: LagCoefficient
inputs.description: Lag coefficient that controls the influence of the previous day's temperature on the current day's temperature

outputs.name: SoilTemperatureByLayers
outputs.description: Soil temperature of each layer (updated state)

functions.name: Math.Exp
functions.description: Returns e raised to the specified power (exponential function) and is used for dumping depth calculation.

functions.name: Math.Log
functions.description: Returns the natural (base e) logarithm of a specified number; used in dumping depth computation.

functions.name: Math.Pow
functions.description: Returns a specified number raised to the specified power (used in scaling/dumping depth computation).
